trans-unit.source: Visualizing your cluster using Service Fabric Explorer
trans-unit.target: Visualizing your cluster using Service Fabric Explorer

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Explorer is a useful GUI tool for inspecting and managing cloud applications and nodes in a Microsoft Azure Service Fabric cluster.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Explorer is a useful GUI tool for inspecting and managing cloud applications and nodes in a Microsoft Azure Service Fabric cluster.

trans-unit.source: Visualizing your cluster using Service Fabric Explorer
trans-unit.target: Visualizing your cluster using Service Fabric Explorer

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Explorer is a visual tool for inspecting and managing cloud applications and nodes in a Microsoft Azure Service Fabric cluster.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Explorer is a visual tool for inspecting and managing cloud applications and nodes in a Microsoft Azure Service Fabric cluster.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Explorer can connect to both local development clusters and Azure clusters.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Explorer can connect to both local development clusters and Azure clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on the Service Fabric PowerShell cmdlets, see the **Next Steps**.
trans-unit.target: For information on the Service Fabric PowerShell cmdlets, see the **Next Steps**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Creation of Service Fabric clusters in Azure is not yet available.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Creation of Service Fabric clusters in Azure is not yet available.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to Service Fabric Explorer
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Service Fabric Explorer

trans-unit.source: Ensure your local development environment is setup by following the instructions at [set up your Service Fabric development environment](service-fabric-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: Ensure your local development environment is setup by following the instructions at [set up your Service Fabric development environment](service-fabric-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Run Service Fabric Explorer from your local installation path (%Program Files%\Microsoft SDKs\Service Fabric\Tools\ServiceFabricExplorer\ServiceFabricExplorer.exe).
trans-unit.target: Run Service Fabric Explorer from your local installation path (%Program Files%\Microsoft SDKs\Service Fabric\Tools\ServiceFabricExplorer\ServiceFabricExplorer.exe).

trans-unit.source: The tool will automatically connect to a local development cluster, if one exists.
trans-unit.target: The tool will automatically connect to a local development cluster, if one exists.

trans-unit.source: It displays information on the cluster such as:
trans-unit.target: It displays information on the cluster such as:

trans-unit.source: Applications running on the cluster
trans-unit.target: Applications running on the cluster

trans-unit.source: Information about the cluster's nodes
trans-unit.target: Information about the cluster's nodes

trans-unit.source: Health events from the applications and nodes
trans-unit.target: Health events from the applications and nodes

trans-unit.source: Load on the applications in the cluster
trans-unit.target: Load on the applications in the cluster

trans-unit.source: Monitoring for application upgrade status
trans-unit.target: Monitoring for application upgrade status

trans-unit.source: Visual representation of the Service Fabric cluster and the deployed applications
trans-unit.target: Visual representation of the Service Fabric cluster and the deployed applications

trans-unit.source: One of the important visualizations is the cluster map, visible on the dashboard for the cluster (e.g. clicking on **Onebox/Local cluster**).
trans-unit.target: One of the important visualizations is the cluster map, visible on the dashboard for the cluster (e.g. clicking on **Onebox/Local cluster**).

trans-unit.source: The cluster map shows the set of upgrade domains and failure domains, and which nodes are mapped to which domains.
trans-unit.target: The cluster map shows the set of upgrade domains and failure domains, and which nodes are mapped to which domains.

trans-unit.source: See the [technical overview of Service Fabric](service-fabric-technical-overview.md) to familiarize yourself with key Service Fabric concepts.
trans-unit.target: See the [technical overview of Service Fabric](service-fabric-technical-overview.md) to familiarize yourself with key Service Fabric concepts.

trans-unit.source: Cluster map shows which upgrade domains and failure domains each node belongs to.
trans-unit.target: Cluster map shows which upgrade domains and failure domains each node belongs to.

trans-unit.source: Viewing applications and services
trans-unit.target: Viewing applications and services

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Explorer allows you to explore the applications running on your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Explorer allows you to explore the applications running on your cluster.

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Application View** to view detailed information on your applications, services, partitions, and replicas.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Application View** to view detailed information on your applications, services, partitions, and replicas.

trans-unit.source: The diagram below shows that the application named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application"** has one stateless service named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application/MyFrontEnd"** and one stateful service named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application/Stateful1"**.
trans-unit.target: The diagram below shows that the application named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application"** has one stateless service named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application/MyFrontEnd"** and one stateful service named **"fabric:/Stateful1Application/Stateful1"**.

trans-unit.source: The stateless service has one partition with one replica running on **Node.4**.
trans-unit.target: The stateless service has one partition with one replica running on **Node.4**.

trans-unit.source: The stateful service has two partitions, each with 3 replicas, running on several different nodes.
trans-unit.target: The stateful service has two partitions, each with 3 replicas, running on several different nodes.

trans-unit.source: View of the applications running on the Service Fabric cluster
trans-unit.target: View of the applications running on the Service Fabric cluster

trans-unit.source: Clicking on an application, service, partition, or replica provides detailed information on that entity.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on an application, service, partition, or replica provides detailed information on that entity.

trans-unit.source: The diagram below shows the service replica health dashboard for one of the primary replicas of the stateful service.
trans-unit.target: The diagram below shows the service replica health dashboard for one of the primary replicas of the stateful service.

trans-unit.source: This includes its role, the node it's running on, address it's listening on, the location of its files on disk, and health events.
trans-unit.target: This includes its role, the node it's running on, address it's listening on, the location of its files on disk, and health events.

trans-unit.source: Detailed information on a Service Fabric replica
trans-unit.target: Detailed information on a Service Fabric replica

trans-unit.source: Connecting to a remote Service Fabric cluster
trans-unit.target: Connecting to a remote Service Fabric cluster

trans-unit.source: To view a remote Service Fabric cluster, click on **Connect** to bring up the **Connect to Service Fabric Cluster** dialog.
trans-unit.target: To view a remote Service Fabric cluster, click on **Connect** to bring up the **Connect to Service Fabric Cluster** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Enter the **ServiceFabric endpoint** for your cluster and click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Enter the **ServiceFabric endpoint** for your cluster and click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: The Service Fabric endpoint is typically the public name of your cluster service listening on port 19000.
trans-unit.target: The Service Fabric endpoint is typically the public name of your cluster service listening on port 19000.

trans-unit.source: Setup a connection to your remote Service Fabric cluster
trans-unit.target: Setup a connection to your remote Service Fabric cluster

trans-unit.source:
